before_start: {"blocks":[{"key":"230o1","text":"Ensure all preliminary steps involved in the process are performed (e.g initially weighing and drying buffer powders)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fg5sj","text":"The pH check is important because changes in the pH might affect mobility of DNA in the agarose gel hence PCR result alteration and misinterpretation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4hfav","text":"The physical stability of the electrophoresis buffer is important because if the powder absorbs moisture from air overtime, they might not be very efficient in allowing migration of DNA samples in the gel which could affect the PCR results.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"98tnq","text":"This protocol describes how to access the physical property of TBE and Borax electrophoresis buffers.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines: {"blocks":[{"key":"6vjpc","text":"Quality control tests are important to ensure the reagents are functioning properly. In this procedure we describe how to access the physical stability and pH of Agarose electrophoresis buffer as this might affect the migration of DNA sample in an Agarose gel electrophoresis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: Stability of agarose electrophoresis buffer, Quality control of agarose electrophoresis buffer

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"e1nad","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bhhbp","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3i795","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"adbje","text":"To confirm the weight of the powder buffer sachet:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":50}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"24gia","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9rv3e","text":"Weigh the individual powder components that constitute the buffer ( the individual powders could be pre-dried if necessary in an incubator with silica gel beads at  )","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":67,"length":98}],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":164,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6semn","text":"Put them together in a beaker and mix.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"l7up","text":"Pour the powder mix in a zip lock sachet and store in an air tight container for 1 to 3 days.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3t4pi","text":"After, open the sachets and pour the powder into a weighing boat and measure the weight of the dried powder.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e234j","text":"The weight should be approximately close to or equal to the weight of the powder before the 3 days storage.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9bnbb","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fkdmc","text":"To confirm the pH of the buffer solution:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":41}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"da3v4","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3pmbs","text":"Pour the powder buffer into an appropriate size beaker and add the appropriate amount of distilled water as indicated on the powder sachet (e.g 1 sachet in 1L water).","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ffs84","text":"Mix until a clear solution is obtained","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cu95q","text":"Use a pH meter to check the pH of the solution which should be between 8.3 and 8.5.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"aa1le","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"c7pv1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"81f4a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ft5k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"e2sqp","text":"The stability test is adopted to test Electrophoresis buffers by confirming the net weight of the dry powder to show it does not absorb moisture from the air after storage and the pH of the buffer solution upon dissolution of the buffer powder","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"AB80FDE0FC5511ECBB8E038F51B20D90","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}
